`regex_replace` is throwing errors on literal characters. Trying to find `?` with `{{ '?'|regex_replace( '\?', '!' ) }}`
see error screenshot
Do you need to match a backslash too? Or is that meant to escape? I don’t think you need to escape that character, just needs brackets. Does `regex_replace( '[?]', '!' )` work for you?
Yes it does. Since the hs documentation on that filter links to Google’s re2 `<https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax>` (which says to escape `*+?()|`), y’all might want to make note of that
Hi is it possible to add a show/hide toggle for an entire custom module?
so at page level it can be disabled instead of deleted
How is the module being added to the page? is it through a flexible column?
if not, you can always add a page level toggle with `export_to_template_context` param on a boolean and then wrap the include of the module with an `{% if var %}` for showing it
yes
Flexible column
why not just remove it?
that is the beauty of the flexible column
They may want to hide it temporarily and bring it back later without having to re add it

ah ok, if its flexible column, you can include a boolean in the module and then wrap the module code in the {% if %} statement. You would then want to have all the options aside from the toggle be shown only if the toggle is set to you. But to <@UD53A9UUR>' point, it might be easier to have them remove/add
yeah, boolean would make it pretty easy
the only thing with doing the above (instead of just removing) is that you will still have the wrapper code show
true
so you would have some excess code bloat (but not enough to be detrimental to load time) unless its on the page 50+ times lol
fill the custom module default values with what they have so when you readd to the page, their stuff is already there
:joy: No just once!
i would do a boolean, it would be faster to code :slightly_smiling_face:
Ok thanks! I will try that

<@UJCV7T0GP> I'm actually creating a template for event pages with that approach - a custom module loaded in the head with all the toggles to show/hide the sections of the page. Sections wrapped in the {% if %}: shows the html if on/ empty div if off - it works :slightly_smiling_face:
